Description: Light-brown marl pottery jar with flat base, ovoid body with convex sides and two pierced tubular-handles at shoulder and flat ledge-rim. The exterior is decorated in brown-paint with vertical panels filled with horizontal lines, in a 'ladder' design. The rim is decorated with diagonal lines.
Curator's comments: Design like Decorated ware D10C in Petrie’s Corpus of Prehistoric Pottery.
Condition: fair (exterior worn and chipped due to salt action)
